snippet: The pace of creation of jobs in the private sector during the current administration is now greater than the pace in either of President George W. Bush’s terms in office.
abstract: Floyd Norris Off the Charts column notes that despite popular sentiment, the pace of job creation in the private sector during the Pres Obama's administration is now greater than it was in either of Pres George W Bush’s terms in office; offers an analysis of job market performance in all presidential administrations since 1957.
lead_paragraph: The pace of creation of jobs in the private sector during the current administration is now greater than the pace in either of President George W. Bush’s terms in office.

headline.print_headline: Obama’s Jobs Number Still Beats Predecessor’s
headline.main: Obama’s Jobs Number Still Beats Predecessor’s
